title: Add size indicators to floating point literals
body:
by **eadfrith**: 
The language specification doesn't explicitly say so, but the type of
floating point literals appears to be float. 

Therefore to declare and initialize variables of type float64 (or float32)
we have to do either

 x := float64(1.0);   

or

 var x float64 = 1.0; 

both of which feel rather verbose.

Adding the optional size indicators "f" and "d" to floating point
literals
would allow us to do:

   x := 1.0f;      // x has type float32
   var x = 1.0f;   // x has type float32

   x := 1.0d;      // x has type float64
   var x = 1.0d;   // x has type float64

which seems a lot cleaner.
